moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4: I perfected this move long ago.
moves.3... Nf6 4. Ng5 d5 5. exd5 b5: A VERY aggresive move. The right move would be is Bf1, and the master did it.
moves.6. Bf1 Nxd5 7. Bxb5: The reason for Bf1 is so if i took the pawn with the queen, you would defend the g2 pawn.
moves.7... Bb7: Would be stuid if i ook the knight.
moves.11. Qf3: Nt the best move, better was Qe4
moves.11... Qxf3 12. gxf3 a6: I jate the pin on my knight.
moves.13. Ba4: Still keeping the pin in place.
moves.13... Bb4 14. a3 Bxc3 15. dxc3 Ke7: Why would i castle if there is an open file there?
moves.16... exf4 17. Bxf4 Nd4: Now the bishop is attacking the rook on h1.
moves.18. Rf1: If Rg1, then Nf3 with a fork.
moves.19... g5: Here i gave up a pawn for an attack.
moves.20. Bxc7 Rd2+ 21. Ke3: King is coming up the board. "Hey white king," says the black king "Do yu want a playdate at my place?"
moves.23... gxf4+ 24. Kxf4 Rxd1 25. Rxd1 Rf8+: And this is all i remember of this game, though the final positon was black king on e6, white king on c5, and white pawn was on a5.
